review: As Far a Burger joints go this one of the Best!  I have never left when I wasn't completely Full but still wanting more of what I eat! Most of the time we come we have to wait 30+ mins. So I guess we're the only ones.  Had another Great burger tonite. Very good, quick, friendly service every time we've gone! They are kid friendly without  being Chuck-E-Cheese. The menu choices are wide enough that I don't ever feel like I don't want to go there.

I def prefer this location to the one in Annapolis. Not just because it's closer to me (I mean I live in Bowie so this one is less than 5 mins away vs. 20 mins lol). Our server the first time my friend and I came was pretty dry, I mean not nice or mean. Second time however, our waiter was super friendly and pretty quick. I will say our food took a long time to come out for a Tuesday night. However when it did get there our burgers were perfect. My friend said there was less sauce on his burger than previous times but still delish. Overall its a pretty good spot for good old American food. You will have to wait long at times but its worth it because your food will usually b perfect, plus bottomless friends, who can resist?

Its a red robin so of course the burgers are good! I went on a Sunday afternoon for lunch which was a bad idea as I was almost run down by at least 2 five year olds just running around with no parent in sight. We were seating really quickly (I assume since we werent a family of 9) and our waiter seemed attentive at first. After awhile he had to be flagged down for things and never in my limited visits to red robin have I had to ask for more fries, since they are "bottomless" that usually bring an extra basket to the table. overall I would re visit the place, just not on "family" day.

Despite the fact that this place does have a bar tucked in the corner and openly advertises their happy hour, this restaurant is winner when it comes to taking the family out to eat. They have great kids menu that is far from overpriced. Let's just say, you can sit down and eat for the same price you pay for that cardboard box at the drive-thru window. Adults can be satisfied here as well with the large selection of burger and chicken sandwich offerings not too mention you can substitute all selections with a turkey burger or black bean patty for the healthier options. Kids young and old (that means us adults too) can feel playful when odering one of their specialty option beverages such as strawberry spreckle lemonade. By the way, all drinks are bottomless, not just the fountain drinks. Red Robins are popping up here and there near local mall areas near you. I am proud to say I joined the Red Robin Royalty club for free so I can earn points for every time I visit. Who doesn't like free stuff.

Um. I have mixed feelings about this place. The burgers are good. I had the one with egg on it.  But the fries sucked. So it seems like onion rings are a better option but I didn't get a chance to tell my waiter that I wanted onion rings instead of fries because he barely came over to our table. And the service seems okay as long as you don't have the last server that we had. He completely forgot to put our appetizer in at all. And didn't seem to take his job as a server very serious. But he did suggests a good drink for me. So I guess that makes it a restaurant floating somewhere in the middle of restaurant mediocrity. I would probably go there again if I'm in the mood for a creative burger. But since I don't eat burgers very much, I'm sure that won't be until some time next year. It seems like a good choice for a group of friends that aren't really trying to spend a lot of money. And it's a good place to keep it casual.

Not sure what all the fuss is about but this is a basic burger joint people, let's all just calm down (smile).  Yes, they have won awards and garnered attention about their delicious food, but chile, please.  There's nothing uniquely special about Red Robbins.  The food isn't bad, but it's not worth a special trip.  If you're already in the vicinity and in the mood for a burger, then it may be worth your while.  Especially since two people can dine for less than $30.  I had the "scroom burger" which is their burger with grilled mushrooms and it was good, but not exceptional.  Their french fries are *delicious* and if you like thick, steak fries seasoned with old bay, you'll be in heaven.  The burger, accompanied by the fries gives this place a solid, well deserved, 3 star rating.  For dessert, I had their brownie lava cake but if you're a chocolate lover, I suggest you skip this dish, lest you be sorely disappointed.  It didn't quite have the rich, smooth, chocolate taste one would expect from a chocolate lava brownie.  Although the strawberries surrounding this dish are a nice touch, they are from a jar and not fresh - it was more of a weak attempt to please.  You may want to try their version of a mud pie which (judging from the pic) looks promising.  I believe there's also an apple dish as well.

Walking by the windows looking in - we see a bunch of empty tables "Great - no wait" I think.  WRONG!   Enter the restaurant and are sort of greeted by the hostesses - all four of them - seemed as if they were doing us a favor by adding our names to the seating list.  Didn't even ask my name-just stared at me while shaking the tablet device as if to imply I should know what to do.  Sometimes I can take a hint - so I give my name and the girl says "15-20 minutes" turns and continues her conversation with the others.   Oh well- so much for not having to wait...sit and wait for a table. I look around and see a number of tables waiting to be cleaned and the notice the floors are a bit sticky.  I think to myself - given the amount of dirty tables and sticky floor one would think out of four hostesses two of whom I would think could lend a hand, pick up a rag and at least wipe tables.   Then I see why the tables and floors look like they do - only one bus boy and he's listening to his iPod (clearly not an in-house earpiece as the guy was bopping his head to the beats he was listening to) and wearing pants way to low - in the all too popular show the underwear style.   Get seated in about 15mins - Great!   Danny - our server was great!  Friendly - welcoming - just seemed like a great guy.   Place an order for the three-for-all fries (steak fries, onion straws, and sweet tater fries).  Fries were good - onion straws a bit greasy - but overall decent. Burgers and salads arrive - pretty decent, but not unlike anything I make at home.   The restaurant is definitely not a quiet place.  Kids screaming and their parents trying to have a conversation speak louder than the screaming kids.  Obviously not Red Robin's fault - but I guess could try and seperate the families from the couples(?).   Also I am not a fan of the overly loud birthday chants - I realize some people seek that attention - and I am happy you're out spending money helping the economy but there has to be a way to find a balance between screaming and clapping for birthday diners (3 within a half hour? - really?).  Not sure of the solution - maybe do once per hour and include all of those celebrating??  To me - if that means to find a quiet dinner somewhere else - so be it. Overall I'll probably go back but maybe just for lunch - during the week when schools are in session.

Having lost power, and thereby all the food in the fridge, my husband and I decided that the best thing to do would be to find a restaurant with power and have ourselves an enjoyable meal.  I was craving burgers, and he'd never been to a Red Robin before.  Pulling up their website, the first thing we see is the featured "FIREY GHOST" burger, and upon seeing it has GHOST PEPPERS in the description, my spicy-hotstuff-loving husband was sold!  (If you read my review of Jewel of India on 2/17, you may remember he very much enjoyed a "kill you spicy" chicken vindaloo.) Getting there was an adventure, with all the downed trees, detours and intersections without power to the traffic lights, the 15-minute drive to Bowie ended up taking us closer to 45 minutes.  However, our efforts were rewarded as we drove into the busy shopping center to discover that yes, indeed, they had power.  The restaurant itself was on about a 25-minute wait, which wasn't surprising.  We meandered on over to the bar to have ourselves a beer while we waited.  Bar: The employee behind the bar took our order, but was evidently too young to pour for us and had to wait for another young person (I guess he was 18 or 19).  She told him what we ordered - she got it right, he didn't.  After correcting his callback twice, he at least gave us the right BEER but the wrong size. He did charge us correctly, though, so I guess that wasn't so bad. Service:  When we finally got seated, it was a bit of a wait before our waiter greeted us.  We were never given water (I eventually asked a floor manager for a glass), we had to ask three times for a particular condiment (my husband wanted an extra side of the ghost pepper ketchup for his fries), and our burgers arrived about five minutes after our appetizers - VERY poorly timed! We had barely time for our appetizers to cool enough to eat before the burgers were in front of us! (I don't know about you, but I happen to like at least a LITTLE bit of time between courses. If we go back I suppose we will have to order our burgers after our appetizers arrive.)  On the positive side, our server was friendly, and I would imagine perhaps a bit overwhelmed by the volume (I have no idea how many people in the surrounding community were without power).   Food: My husband very much liked his burger.  He felt it was spicy enough (he expected less spicy as he is often disappointed by the lack of heat and flavor in "spicy" food at chain restaurants), and our appetizers were very good.  The oil in the fryer must have been clean, because our appetizers (onion rings and fried mushrooms) were not overly saturated with grease and the breading was a nice light color.   I ordered the Prime Chophouse, which I felt had too high a ratio of bread to burger.  However, once I took off the top bun (cut it in half and folded it over) the flavors came out more I rather enjoyed it. The Dijon was nice and zesty.  I wouldn't say the burger itself is anything special, and I've been to places with some amazing burgers that are wonderful without any sort of added toppings.  What Red Robin has going for it is that they have a wide variety of very tasty flavor combinations. Then again, I guess they have to, since the burger patty itself really isn't all that interesting, nor is it large enough. Rating: I would give this place a two-star rating, but since my husband was so impressed with the ghost pepper burger I am going to give it a 3 (really more of a 2.5, but yelp doesn't allow that).  Thanks for reading. =)

When Mr. Logical and I stupidly tried to run errands during a massive power outage, we hit up Red Robin for lunch.  It was a little comical to see everyone charging their cellphones, tablets, and ereaders in the waiting area (there are some hidden outlets if you look).  I had the prime chophouse burger, Mr. Logical the buzzalo burger, both with sweet potato fries.  Mine was pretty good, Mr. Logical wasn't that impressed with the spiciness of his.  There was a fairly long wait for the number of empty tables, and the hostess seemed a little oblivious to what was going on.

First, my family and I love Red Robin. It's a super kid friendly restaurant.  Nice variety of food and always yummy. You have to try the Onion Ring Tower if you never have.  By far, their best app. We dined there last night and the service was not our usual.  Our appetizer came out with our meal.  We didn't wait long for it to be served which was nice, but what's the point of the appetizer if it comes out with your dinner? Secondly, at the end of our meal, our waitress did not clear our plates.  THIS IS A PET PEEVE for me.  I used to wait tables and this is a MUST.  PRE BUS people!  If you want me to order dessert, clear my damn food.  I even stacked plates and bowls for her and set them on the edge to try and get the point across. We will dine again, hopefully not with that waitress!

Haha!  Red Robin is a club?!  Ok - well, maybe it's not a club, but it felt like one Friday night.  The hubs and I went to a movie and wanted to grab a low-key late night nibble nearby.  Red Robin glowed bright in its bold red hue, so we made the trip there. I have never seen so many happy teens chompin' on burgers in my laugh. LOL!  The odd thing is, there was a table of elderly women getting loud right next to them and a family of all ages at a long table in the back.  It was almost 11 at night, so the combo of kids from 2 to 18 coupled with adults up to 89ish both amazed and impressed me.   Why do I bring this up?  Because it speaks to Red Robin's appeal.  If you can get these demos in one spot on a Friday night, then I would say whatever you are doing marketing-wise is working.  To be honest, I just wanted to go here because you can get drinks with your burgers (something tells me the grandmas were there for the same reason), but I forgot all about the shakes and desserts, which must have attracted the kiddies. So, what about the food? Solid.  The burgers are fab, but the salads are weak if you are trying to go light.  Honestly, I haven't strayed too much for anything else on the menu.  Seems it's a "go big or go home" type place for me.  Fries are good, but not the best.  3-stars for being a family friendly restaurant with alcohol - a winning combo if you ask me! lol! P.S.  I don't know who does the training here, but the serving staff is johnny on the spot with making sure you are taken care of - even late night.  In fact, they can be a little too much so (i.e. stopping by the table every 30 seconds), but I would rather have that than be ignored.  Hats off to the staff!  They have a good time, but they get the work done and are very pleasant!

We went their on Sunday afternoon after church. The place was pretty dead, and it took them 20 mins. to seat us.  The waiter was a bit weird; my cousin ordered a chicken sandwich and asked "You like the chicken with a little pink or no pink?" umm no pink please. He rarely checked up on us to see everything was fine, and when he did, he came back 10 mins. later with what we needed. I've experienced WAYYY better at the one in Columbia/Snowden.

Went yesterday (10/14) around 5:30, it wasn't packed but it wasn't empty either. We were seated right away. Our waiter (I don't remember his name...I swear I'll do better with this) was cordial.  I ordered tenders, fries and a side salad. Oh, and a frozen Ultimate Margarita. The margarita wasn't super tasty..it was actually a bit sour but I drank it anyway. I had to ask to have my salad come out before the rest of my meal. WHEN did this become common practice?! I thought the salad was supposed to come BEFORE the meal and not WITH it. Anyhow, When he did bring it, I needed extra Ranch (that I never got) and oil & vinegar (that I didn't get until after I'd already eaten my salad). I've never worked in the food service industry and I've never been a waitress but I imagine that it doesn't take much to get a small cup of salad dressing. My tenders showed up to the table sans fries but they came about 5 minutes later.  The overall experience was...eh...I'm not a huge fan of Red Robin to begin with. Would I go back? Probably.

Service was trash, burger was burnt and bun fell apart. Fries were cold and chicken was so dry my 2 year old son wouldn't eat it. A great idea is stop cooking frozen bulkshit food and use fresh food and hire a real cook. The ice tea tasted like it was made fresh years ago and it was very dirty in there. Avoid this horrible place at all costs and dmgo to FIVE GUYS. FIVE GUYS is a WAY better place for a fresh burger.

This is a nice casual family place where you can grab a drink and a little something to eat and be one your way.  The problem is by the time you get a table and food you will likely be late to where you are going.  It is sad when a places popularity is the contributing factor to why it is less than an ideal place to go.  If you go to Red Robin be prepared to wait for a table and wait for your food once you get a table and don't be in a rush.  They have a nice atmosphere be it a little on the bright side, an excellent menu with plenty of appetizers, a nice vegetarian selection, and last but not least a generous beer selection.  This place suffers from high staff turnover so don't get too attached to you server or bartender.  The bar is not big enough,  The restaurant is not big enough or could it just be too popular.  Take your pick.   They could have easily kept the Crofton space open and still made a mint.

Getting to be a bit pricey for what you get.  Food quality is very good,  wait staff is a little inexperienced.  One of the quieter ones we have been to-which was nice-  I could actually have a conversation and hear my family. Could get a better burger for less though.
We had a real long wait time but our waiter did a great job under a very busy Saturday rush.  This is our first time to this location and overall we were fairly pleased.

I liked it! I ordered the standard cheeseburger and was thoroughly pleased. It's a big patty with a lot of fixins and of course the bottomless steak fries. My friend got the Banzai Burger, which she said was pretty damn good as well. She also ordered sweet potato fries, which were definitely the move (really, when are they NOT the move?). I also slurped up their salted caramel shake, which was delicious. Super friendly service, a bit of a wait to get a table on a Saturday night but that's not too surprising. I'll be back.

We've been here a few times and each time has been mediocre. Last time we ordered food to go they forgot 2 of our order items so when we got home and realized this, we had to call, and get refunded. This last time we tried to order to go, I was placed on hold for 10 minutes while 3 different people picked up and put me back on hold. When I told the 3rd person I had been on hold for 10 minutes and wanted to place my order, he was completely unapologetic. I had to repeat my name several times for him and after I was finished ordering, he just hung up! SO RUDE. My boyfriend went to pick up the food 10 minutes later, and they told him they had NO order under any such name. Unbelievable, pretty much every other location I've been to is better than this one. I would have called and complained to manager, but apparently the average wait time when you call is 10 minutes. Go to a different Red Robin.

It is really nice having this place across the street.  It has become our go to spot since DuClaw changed their menu for the worst.  The burgers here are great and I like the french fries.  They have some nice healthier options and everything we have tried has been really yummy.  They have great ice cream, shakes, and drinks and the staff is always friendly and attentive.   Bowie Red Robins fans beware....a Red Robin location is opening up in the new Crofton shopping center, which has spelled doom for several Bowie Town Center locations (Petco, Old Navy, BB&B).  Lets hope that Red Robin does not share the same fate.

I came to this particular Red Robin because I needed to find a middle ground for our family and for my friends family (that's closer to DC) to meet for my daughters 1st Birthday. Since we already had the big party a month prior back home in Ca.. I still wanted to do a little something on the day of. My friend made one of her homemade fancy birthday cakes for my daughter and the restaurant was kind enough to put it in their fridge while we dined. The staff was so friendly that we gave half the cake to him to take home and share with whomever.. He was grateful. :) Our daughters love the Red Robin back in Newport News, Va because the food is always spot on. This one however seriously lacked on the burgers. They were dry.. Room temp and lackluster. The fries were cold so we didn't dive into 2nds at all which has never happened. The staff was friendly but I have to say that we won't be back to this location.
Poor service, food was okay, reasonably priced, but place need to be cleaned up more. The front staff were rude and unfriendly. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
I loved it. hadn't been in a long time and went on my Birthday. the food was good, quick and the servers were great. we shut the place down and plan on going back again!
One of my favorite places to get a burger and the seasoning on the fries is addicting.

Hubby and I just came back from Red Robin in Bowie, MD.  He loved his peppercorn burger.  The new red, white, and blue salad was just okay.  His onion stack was great.  But the guacamole that came with my tortillas was not fresh (you could see where it had started turning brown from sitting out).  When I asked for a replacement I got a container of even colored guac, but it had been obviously stirred to evenly distribute the brown discoloration.  If we go again I'll only get a burger.

Despite my 3 stars, I love Red Robin, and because I do, I have to be honest with them. YES the service is great, the food is awesome, and I love the atmosphere. I do not  eat at most sit-down restaurants and Red Robin has kept me interested. It is always delicious and they are always updating their menu. I was going to Red Robin in Annapolis before this one was built and BOY WAS I EXCITED THAT IT WAS COMING TO BOWIE! ...but recently...I ran into a problem...the bottomless fries. SO recently the portion size for the fries have been a little small and the buzzard wings ALSO shrank in size. VERY disappointing because they are pricy but they were delicious and satisfying. They used to be worth the money, but now I don't even bother with Red's appetizers anymore because of it. So the big issue: My family and I ordered fries after our meal. 3 of us wanted one extra serving of fries, but the waitress said that they could only give us ONE....and it was SMALL. Maybe 6 fries in it. EVEN IF THEY GAVE US 6 EACH I WOULD'NT BE THAT UPSET. RED ROBIN.. DO NOT ADVERTISE BOTTOMLESS FRIES IF EACH PERSON CANNOT ORDER EVEN ONE EXTRA! I understand how there may be complications to getting fries to everyone all of the time, but my issue is....JUST DON'T advertise it if it cannot be done. My milkshake didn't even come with a refill cup..which I should have gotten....as stated in the menu! I really don't appreciate this! This has me bothered because I never had this issue at the Annapolis location...or Bowie's before that night!..and the food used to come with more fries so I never HAD to ask for more! My waitress was wonderful, but the establishment needs to quit this nonsense. In comparison, Carrabbas portion sizes shrank SIGNIFICANTLY and their prices just skyrocketed...PLEASE DO NOT JOIN THEM RED ROBIN! I am a HUGE fan and I feel like you are letting me down!!!

Daytime bartender, heavier set african american gentleman, was outstanding. Diddnt catch his name but he was friendly, attentive, and a great personality. Will be back to this location due to him alone. Food was okay, but good daytime bar service was a pleasant suprise.kudos.

With so many hamburger joints, how can you choose which one to go to?  Well, I typically find a non-chain and if that isn't possible, it's either Fuddruckers or Red Robin for me, well on the East coast.  Hamburger places must have good burgers and good fries.  For instance McDonald's burger are terrible but their fries are good and a Whopper is ok, but their fries are terrible.  So, Red Robin has both good burger and fries.  It's the only place I can get an egg on a burger (the Red Robin Royale) and their steak fries rock.  And the fries are bottomless.  Yup, all you can eat.  The burger, while good, isn't the best.  It certainly is way above any fast food joint.  So if you are looking for a nice clean sit down restaurant and delicious golden steak fries, then come on over!
5 stars for tonight  because Darnell was a great server. Service is usually a bit slow. Love the food . The burgers are great the chicken and salads awesome!   getting our free entree topped it off.

I love Red Robin...they probably make the best veggie burger and fries around.  With that said, this particular location is pretty bad. It's very hit-or-miss. At times, the food is great, service is decent, and things are fine. At other times, the service is TERRIBLE (and I mean terrible..) and the food comes out cold, parts of the order are missing, the server ignores you or takes forever to come take your order. The past few times I have been here have fallen into the "terrible" category. I came by myself for lunch one day, and the server took everyone else's order except mine. He basically just ignored me, until I frantically waved at him and demanded that he come over. He then acted like I was bothering him the rest of the time. I never do this, but I didn't leave a tip. I had never experienced rudeness like that before. The next time, my husband and I came for dinner and we sat in the bar area to avoid a long wait. We were given menus right away, but then the server took FOREVER to take our orders. Then, we waited over 30 minutes for our food (all we ordered was a veggie burger and regular burger). When it finally came, the order was messed up, and the server just gave me a blank look and said "sorry"... Her response was really weird.  Honestly, I put up with the bad service here because I like the food and it's close to my house. Otherwise, I would go elsewhere. Other Red Robins are A LOT better (try the one in Towson!)

Food was not great at all.  Service was even worse.  Broccoli was not edible at all.  "Endless" fries require a waitress that actually comes back to ask you if you want more which they did not do.  Save your time and just go to Five Guys if you just want a burger.  It will taste much better.
This location has gone downhill in the past few years. They are so slow and the wait staff could care less about anything.  Drive to the Waugh Chapel location, it's 1000x better.

Listen I'm always surprised when young people get their first few jobs and develop a bad attitude like they've been working 20 years or so. That's why I was surprised when Sasha greeted our table so poorly and we waited some time before she came over and had to ask where she was. There were only a few people in the restaurant . She brought over one plate with no fries and the other with cold fries. When I told her the fries were cold she said, yeah they are making some more. I guess she figure better to give you old cold fries than none?

I love red robin and this location doesn't disappoint. I've been here several times and have never had a bad experience. If you've never been to this chain or just haven't found a burger you like here do yourself a favor and get the red's big tavern burger "pig out style". OMG it's one of the best burgers I've ever had! If you wanna smaller version they also offer the red's tavern double which has 2 small patties instead if 1 big one.

Turrible!!!!  Started off bad and kept getting worse...  Couldn't get the basics right - seated at a dirty table, didn't get silverware until well after our food was delivered, drinks took nearly as long as the food!! Had to ask for drink refills and those took 20 minutes!  Asked for bottomless fries and never saw them...   Every time we had to remind our waiter, Chris, about what we needed, he made excuses like it was someone else's job.  Not the right answer! MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT!!!

This chain rates on par with any other franchised store. The burgers are standard as any other Red Robin. The service is always good, always friendly and attentive.  The food delivery speed has gotten better in the past year as well so they are doing good! Haven't had any issues and enjoy getting a good Red Robin burger from here every so often .

I don't think I've ever had such slow and poor service in my entire life.  This Red Robin sucks, service-wise! My fiance and I get there on a Saturday night.  There's a long wait and we opted to dine in the bar instead. It took more than 15 minutes before a waitress came to our table.  There were waitresses walking past us and serving others even those who arrived after us.  The bartender, when caught up on orders, would help customers but ignored our table. When the waitress came, she asked if anyone helped us and we replied no.  Then, she said, "do you want me to help you?"   No, we're just sitting down and people-watching.  Of course, we'd like to be helped with our orders. We ordered our drinks and placed our orders and then asked for a basket of fries. The waitress was not to be seen again.  More than 15 minutes passed and still no drinks or fries.  I spied her serving a table in the general dining area.  Instead of gathering all the orders for all parties at the table, she'd go and get something and bring it to one person.  Then, turn to the other person at the same table.  She'd go and retrieve.  Then, she asked a kid at the same table and went off for some items.  She can't multi-task.   There were people at the table next to us who had been there before us.  They were also waiting for the waitress as well.  We kept looking at each other in shock. The manager had to come out and bring out drinks as they were left untouched at the bar.  When the manager brought out drinks, we informed him of the lousy service.  He just simply shrugged his shoulders and mumbled a sorry.  (He did remove my alcoholic drink from the bill.) Another waitress brought out food.  I had the Clucks and Shrimp.  It was pretty good.  However, the bad service really distracted us from enjoying our meal. The waitress finally arrived at our table when we were mid-way finished with our meal.  She was like, "I'm so sorry".   Yeah, yeah, you're not doing a good job.  We asked for a refill.  Good Lord!  It took a good 10 minute wait.  When she arrived, we asked for the check because God knows when we'd see her again.   Anyways, the point is that the staff at this Red Robin need to be retrained because service was just unacceptable.  There's no way I'd return to this location!

Great service in the bar area. I was eating by myself due to a severe pregnancy craving and the waiter was on top of everything! The classic cheeseburger was well done, just as I requested. The fries are thicker than I normally like but these were tasty!
The service in this restaurant was excellent other restaurants in Bowie need go amd see what service is.  The food was done well.  Love the bottomless french fries and bottomless root beer float.

The staff was very professional & friendly however,  it's never a good sign when your appetizer shows up after your entrée.  The kitchen dragged the overall score down. How does this even happen? As a customer this I feel like it showed up that late it should be on the house.

Feeling really generous tonight, so rating tonight's visit with 4 stars.  Actually, its the bartender and the food that gets high marks.  One bartender serving bar, service bar, and all the tables in the bar area.  Kept him hopping, for sure.  Food was good as always, but they certainly needed more help.  Tables went uncleaned for longer than they should, drink refills were slower than they should be.  I'm convinced that slow weekend service is due to one major factor -- lousy weekend managers.  Tonight's manager was no exception.  Overall the staff needs better training and a manager that doesn't just twirl around like he's clueless.  Comments that overall the service here is poor are spot on.

Slowest service I've ever had! Our appetizer came out 30 minutes after we ordered it and during the time our waitress named Terri never came to check up on us. Our food came 1 hour after we ordered it!

Terrible service.  Never got 1 refill. Bottemless fries had a bottom, never refilled. $15 burger had wilted lettuce, top stem part of the tomato. Terrible!!!!! Never again. Burger was tasteless and dry. Better off going to 5 guys, cheaper and more fries and they are hot and fresh. Waiter was messing up every table. Manager made excuses. Really? Don't seat us if you can't handle the volume. Avoid this place. Waste of time and money. This is a service industry - if you can not provide the minimum level of service - close your doors. Bad service, even worse food, lousy management.

Tried to give it a second shot last night and it was still a fail.  Burger brought out by itself because the fries weren't ready - WHAT!!!!  Unacceptable.  Told them to take the burger away - I like to have my food arrive at the same time and not be waiting with food going cold, a concept that they could not grasp.  Spoke to the manager - who then had my cold burger and fries with him, he said sorry - do you want it now.  Husband said lets go, got check and two bites of his burger and two speckled lemonades later - almost $16.  Will not go back to Bowie Red Robin again - will take the extra hike to Crofton.

Went out with friend and we stopped by here.  I usually go to one near my home so I was used to certain level of customer service.  Welp this place was HORRIBLE! We sat at table and took them 10 minutes to clean off. Friend ordered milkshake yet they gave her a margarita  (she doesn't drink). Food came out and my fries were cold and there was tarter sauce on my bun.  Huh? I ordered a burger! Ordered more fries and next ones came out and noticed barbecue sauce on them. I'm like are you giving us food left at another damn table?! Ok friend decided to try dessert. ..red velvet cake. They put some sort of strawberry preserve drizzle on the cake.  Ewwww. Sloppy food and inadequate service...won't go back there.

Very disappointing experience.  I went to the Crofton location, yesterday, and had one of the best Artisan burgers of my life. It was juicy, cooked as I ordered it, and very flavorful. I had to have another one, today, but didn't want to drive back to Crofton, so I went to the Bowie location.  Sigh!  It's Saturday night and the place was packed, so I expected to have a wait,,,no problem waiting.  When the burger arrived, it was not medium, as I ordered, but extremely well done and dry; no juiciness at all.  It tasted like char.  The brownie cake was also very dry, not moist like the one I had on Friday.  I ordered it to go and instead of getting a scoop of ice cream, I was given soft-serve ice cream.  Very disappointing experience.  The only positive experience was the person who took my order, she was very nice and attentive.  I will stick with the Crofton location.

This was my first time ever dining at at Red Robin. My family came to celebrate a birthday; a party of 9. The drinks came out fairly slow but not too bad. We waited forever for the food to arrive. Had to ask the server and manager 3 times about the food. Once the food arrived, everyone, and i mean everyones food was cold! We sent it back and asked for it to go. The restaurant was not packed, so we were confused as to the delay. None the less the server ANGEL had lots of patience, and even though she may have been frustrated she stayed professional. The Manger Corey H. was also extremely apologetic, and had our food remade and boxed to go. The overall service was horrible, but i did  appreciate the effort of both the server, and manager in attempting to rectify the problem(s). I don't think i'll be going back but they were nice and did try to fix the problem.

When I was in college I worked at Red Robin so I have a strong affection for the brand. As a CDT (Certified Dedicated Trainer) and also bar manager I understand how their process is supposed to work. I also understand the variables that occur and how demanding working in the restaurant business can be. On multiple occasions I've left the Bowie location with issues and just last month my wife and I agreed we were never returning. Today I gave in and told her I'd pick dinner up and bring it home. I called to place my order four times and the phone rang without answer each time after selecting the carry out option. I was 20 minutes away so our food should've been ready when I arrived instead I took a seat at the bar with my debit card in hand only to be ignored for 15 minutes with 3 bartenders on duty and only 3 other people seated by me.  I've given them multiple chance before posting a lackluster review. Partly because of brand loyalty but also because this location hasn't been here for too long and I was chalking up my dissatisfaction to growing pains and the learning curve, trusting management knew their issues and would correct their shortcomings. The last time we ate in it was 10 minutes before we were greeted, another 5 to get our sodas, and another 10 to place our order only to have my burger delivered to the table next to us, the lady pick it up,  place it back in the basket, say that wasn't what she ordered, and then have it placed in front of me. Five minutes later my wife's salad came missing the bread and the waitress returned with 4 pieces of bread on a plate, stuck the plate in my wife's face and said "here take one." My wife refused to touch the plate and then have the other 3 pieces served other people and requested her bread be delivered on a separated plate. We never got it.  This trip was in early December in the middle of flu season and the lady that touched my burger was coughing into her hand throughout dinner. Pretty gross and a violation of health code on multiple levels. Not her coughing but she touched my dinner and if it wasn't hers it should've been trashed. We took my burger to go and fed it to our dog. She didn't get sick but I wasn't risking it myself. I had a couple fries. The bill was delivered, 10 minutes to swipe my card and no pen was delivered with our print out. Luckily my wife had one and we escaped in slightly over an hour but I was still hungry. Not to good for a chain that has a two minute greet policy and eight minute cook times. Even if you chewed every bight 26 times and had desert you should never ever be at a Red Robin for more than 30-40 minutes max. We were one of 4 tables seated on a Sunday night and there's no excuses for how bad they were, it was ridiculous.  The two stars are split one for the food and the other for the building. The food is good and the taste, quality, and consistency are what I expect from Red Robin. The kitchen isn't the problem here. I believe the server calls for the warm bread to be put on the salad so the lettuce stays cold. Salads obviously quicker than burgers to prepare but it was delivered late and incomplete. This would be a server issue and service here is definitely the biggest hurdle they have to overcome. What they call "Table Visits" were required by management back when I was there. It was important for management to check in and get feedback with the clients and I can say in all of our trips we've never once had a manager come and ask us how everything was. Maybe starting this would fix their deficiencies and since we've never been visited and we do care, Yelp seems to be the best way to provide our feedback. Again this store isn't terribly old maybe a few years now and it was previously very open and very noisy. They've already remodeled installing glass partitions between the sections and changed the lighting so the second star is for some of the location issues being addressed and corrected. Hopefully this review reaches someone with the ability to bring Bowie back up to cooperate standards and if so and by the small chance we do ever go back I'd be more than happy to revise my review. I didn't want to in the first place but whether dining in or taking it to go they've made it very difficult to eat there. It's worse now the when it was brand new, I hadn't eaten at Red Robin in years and we were excited for the opening only to be let down over and over again. It's really a shame.

Sounds like the service here is really hit-or-miss. I was lucky enough to get good service, which made up for the wobbling table. Burgers and fries were decent but not  extraordinary. I was asked if I wanted my burger cooked "pink" or "no pink," and I chose "pink" but what I got was "no pink." Oh well, at least it was still juicy. You have to ask for it, but they have a delicious homemade, peppery ketchup. I don't even like ketchup and I thought it was delicious.

Great customer service in the bar area. I have eaten in the dining area and the service was good there also. I just love these burgers!  When I do carry out it's always ready on time and hot.  they actually prepare the burger to your liking per your request.

When I ask my sons which restaurant do they want to go to eat at- Red Robin is always the answer by all 3. They love this place. We always order the same thing. They love the Red Robin burger with the egg fried hard, I get the Whiskey River BBQ with sweet potato fries. For appetizers, Onion rings & those delicious pretzel bites with the cheese dipping sauce, OMG, they're so good. Bottomless root beer floats for all 3 and a couple drinks for me. While we wait for our food to be brought to us, we entertain ourselves by looking at the artwork placed on the ceiling. My sons and I lean our heads back and browse through the artwork with our eyes, while describing our favorites.  The food is always good and the service is usually on point. And now that they've upgraded the entire interior, they've really stepped their game up with their appearance. The place is always a winner in my books, because it makes my 3 boys happy.
This has to be the worst Red Robin... I'm giving them one star for the waitress having a pretty smile other than that it was a terrible experience. We would have been better off going to Five Guys.

Great chain establishment, but this is a too often disappointing location. Waitstaff and runners are tops though peak capacity stresses them to the limit. The kitchen is the culprit here. Consistently inconsistent. The waiter will ask how you like your burger, but know it's coming out however the cook wants it to be. 90% of the time plan on well done to crispy sides and dry. It will be the buns and condiments that save the day. Drinks are pricey, but the appetizers are fun and yummy. Open floor plan is really loud and chaotic. There are so many other choices in the area, you come here because you want your Red Robin fix and accept the mediocrity of this location.
Service slow. Food served cold. Tables/under tables dirty.  Worst experience I have ever had at a Red Robin. No yummmm here.

The African American woman with the long straight hair behind the bar this evening (3/27/15) is totally rude and has a severe lack of customer service skills.  She "literally" rolled here eyes to the back of her head whenever I asked her for ANYTHING!  I realize she was working service bar but the bartender was away.  Politely asking for ketchup, mustard and napkins in a BURGER JOINT should never warrant a nasty attitude.  Perhaps, she's in the wrong industry.  -Sorry I'm interrupting your conversations ma'am!

When we entered the hostesses looked sad to be working there .... Should have known it was going to be bad by that alone... It took forever to get service ... The onion rings were ok ... Definitely have had better .... But then I ordered the "garden burger" ... This burger was disgusting it consisted of dehydrated rice and mushrooms .... I don't know what garden they got that from but it was disturbing .... False advertisement if you ask me veggie burgers usually contain some black beans and corn ... You know veggies ... I can't have cheese so there was nothing to mask the disgusting taste of  this fried rice cake ... I sent it back along with the not so fresh side salad I ordered with it ... To top it off the manager came out  and warns me to next time stay away from the garden burgers ...EXCUSE ME ! ... But maybe you all should add produce that actually grows in a garden to this burger he made us pay for half the price of the burger... Which I was upset about because I took only 2 bites ... (First bite because that's what you do when you get your food ... Second bite to reconfirm that it was as disgusting as the first bite) he offered something to go but I refused I didn't need to taste anymore of their disgusting food... Idk how they are still open the quality of food is well there is no quality ... five guys burgers are way better .. Also Copper Canyon has an epic veggie burger that guess what contains veggies .... This was a terrible experience took forever to check out as well I walked out my bf handled the rest because I was close to going off ... I WILL NEVER EVER GO BACK OR RECOMMEND THIS CHAIN TO ANYONE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Much worse than the average Red Robin. Had to wait for the hostess together her act together, even though there were open tables. Tile floor was greasy and slick, like someone had spilled oil on it then mopped up without using soap or a degreasing cleanser. Server was slow, inattentive and forgot the beer order at first. Food was ok, but sat on the bar waiting for server to pick up (though there was nothing else going on that I could see) for an extended time. Based on prior experience with Red Robin, I'm very disappointed.

As others have noted, something must have changed at Red Robin - Bowie recently that has sent it downhill. Normally the food and service are both of decent quality. However, my recent visit (Sunday April 12) was horrible. My wife and I were seated in a reasonable amount of time, and the server (Xavier) was quick to our table for our drink and food order, and that is about where the good part of the experience ends. A runner did bring our food in a slightly longer than average time, and that was the only time during the meal that anyone from Red Robin stopped by our table. No server, manager, or runner (other than food delivery) came by in the 40 minutes or so between ordering and getting the bill. This means: No Flatware provided - we had to get the hostess to get us some. Empty condiment containers on table - had to grab someone as they passed to get them replaced. No checking if the order was correct and if the food was satisfactory. No offers to refill fries - which considering I got the few from the bottom of the heat pan with all the crumbs and salt - would have been nice. No refills on drinks despite empty glasses on the edge of the table for 15 minutes. When the server finally came by again, it was with bill in hand, and asking "if we were ready to close out". It certainly was not a meal that left a positive impression, and may keep me from going back to the Bowie Location.

We satin the bar area and started with a short stack of onion rings. My spouse got a cheeseburger which was huge and the creamy cole slaw was rich and creamy. Got the garden burger, which was great and I added seasoned fries. These were the steak fries with garlic Parmesan and parsley. Go with the regular fries. Two glasses of trinity oaks wine were good.  Good service.

Food came out crazy fast, service was top notch (thanks Kelley). And FINALLY someone who gets it... Countless times my daughter has burned herself on food that was brought from the kitchen. Not here they had the sense of mind to let pizza cool before giving it to a 5 yo. Bonus points there.

Always a good place to get a quick bite to eat. I usually sit at the bar however at this time with my son I had to wait in the line. But once you get seated, the service is so quick. It's okay even if there's a 20 minute wait. I always go for the turkey burgers and the sweet potato fries. Even though the sweet potato fries tend to be cooked a little hard. There are Just enough TVs to catch some sport from across the room. Today I had a chance to watch the Kentucky Derby and a little bit of the NFL Draft. Good quick dinner with my son. I recommend if you're over 21 to always catch a seat at the bar. The service there is even quicker. I come here for lunch often and usually in and out in less than 30 minutes. And of  Course they have a full service bar also.

I have been to too many Red Robins not to know how they are supposed to function. Everything is typically timed perfectly. However, not this time. This location is AWFUL. Our food took almost 40 minutes to come out.  My Royal RR burger was only supposed to have no mayo, no tomato, and an egg fried hard. Egg was not fried hard, No bacon or lettuce on the burger.  The Gardenburger was requested to come with mayo. Guess the kitchen was like, "no". Her plate had between 6 or 8 fries, She was never asked did she want more.  The Grilled Chix on a stick for the girl-child -Greasy.  The Red Robin Burger for the boy-child, mediocre.  No drinks were refilled even after we asked.  No manager came around at all during the entire time we were there.  All that means is that we know now that a bad RR exists and we won't be coming back. Sorry kiddos. We know it's your fave, but not this one. Not ever.

I recently had a subpar experience here. There seemed to be reticence about where to seat me - despite there being multiple tables. I owed for the bar area, which seemed a bit neglected: My table lacked ketchup (other tables needed refills) and  clean silverware (see image). My waiter seemed spread thin but tried his best. The whole experience - including the skimpy fries - seemed disjointed. Not my best RR experience - not even close.

The food was typical Red Robin and the service was pretty good. My one issue was the cleanliness of the dining room floor. They were sitting guests at tables that had trash under them. It was in the middle of the dining room so it was hard to ignore. There were also alot of unbussed tables. Makes me feel like the management has no pride and doesn't care.

In all honesty, for a gourmet burger joint, this Red Robin failed to deliver.  Upon arrival, the hostess and manager couldn't figure out where to seat us as they fiddled with an iPad.  So they offered seating in the bar, which was fine.  Then the server forgot a few items and the table-side kiosk was of no help in flagging the server for drink refills.  Anyway, the burgers were just okay.  We were given two choices on how we wanted the burgers - "some pink in the middle" or "well done".  I prefer "medium well", but that's not a choice here.  The A-1 Burger was sad and the "bottomless fries" at this location is a gimmick.  They only give you a few fries (like 7) on the plastic plate that they serve the burger on.  The food presentation was pathetic, and I asked for more fries as soon as the burger arrived.  Other RRs are better than this location in Bowie.

Getting seated was easy enough but it was all down hill from there.  We had to wait 10 minutes for a server to even come to the table to take a drink order.  I ordered water with lemon and 2 packets of sweet and low and she completely forgot about it and that was another 15 minutes after she was reminded.  After the orders were taken she read it back twice and to my amazement it was STILL WRONG.  It was exhausting to keep asking for things she forgot.  I ordered the fish and chips, and the server had to nerve to bring my order without the dill and pickled tarter sauce.  Although it says it comes with it the waitress told me I had to ask for it... REALLY!  BTW the fish and chips was over cooked and dry.  Not good eats!  Our server, Stacy must be new or she is not aware of the menu.  I think that some retraining and or coaching would be helpful to the waitstaff.
Always nice friendly service, food is always great, I recommend the peach milkshake and the tavern burger. The fries are always a must, especially when you put their very own seasoning on them.

One of the dopest places I've been in a while, from the gigantic onion rings, to the mouth watering burgers to the awesome drinks and customer service, I cant wait to come back!!! I wish I knew my servers name but she had the cutest dimples and made the best drinks!!! . Cudos!!!!

I cannot even begin to describe my experience along with my husband at Red Robin this evening. Although it's only Thursday afternoon, I have to admit I was extremely surprised by how few people were in Red Robin.  As you can see from the picture attached to this review, there were not that many customers in the restaurant. So you can imagine our surprise when it took almost 10 minutes to get two glasses of water with lemon. Now granted they did come out with our drinks from the bar, but again a glass of wine and a real quick cocktail should not have taken 10 minutes. My husband and I ordered three appetizers and two burgers. After 22 minutes of waiting for the appetizers themselves to come out, not even the burgers mind you just the appetizers, we called the restaurant manager over to our table. We insisted to only pay for drinks that way we could leave. If it was taking 22 minutes to get appetizers, we could only imagine how long it would take to get our burgers.  Irony of ironies, right as we were explaining our displeasure to the manager our burgers came out. I did not say appetizers - I said our main meals. We explained how unacceptable it was not only to have to wait this long, but the fact that our main entrees to come out before the appetizers is just ludicrous. The manager said he would take the appetizers off of our bill but we can still have them for free if we wanted to. We said okay we would take him for free, and then somehow someway the appetizers magically appeared on our table less than a minute later. But wait, it gets better. Most of the way through our meal we discovered a hair in our queso. I attached a picture of it here for you to judge what it the hair look like. What type of hair does it look like to you? If it's not a pubic hair, then maybe it's a hair from someone's beard. This brings into question if members of the kitchen crew are wearing beard guards, as restaurant safety regulations require. We were disgusted and left the premises as soon as we paid for our drinks. We will never go back there again.

Because of the terrible service I'm giving it one star. I waited for someone to assist me where to place my order- I was told at the bar... Stood at the bar- and bartenders were sitting around talking ( African American with burgundy hair& a African American male with light brown hair) did not even ask if I needed assistance- then I proceeded to ask them were they able to take orders they told me no- BUT took 4 other orders about 5 minutes after I asked. So I left. HORRIBLE SERVICE. They had attitudes- i hope management sees this review and takes action.

Me and my girlfriend came here because we were hungry after shopping all day. We had a taste for a burger and decide on getting the bacon cheeseburger. My friends burger came out perfect but mine did not come out the way that I ordered. Got a second to replace the first order and that still wasn't correct. one of the managers by the name of Johnny told me that that's the way that the last burger was and I told him yes I know that that's why had to re-order because the first order was incorrect. I spoke with another manager by the name of Amanda and she corrected the order without a problem. She was very professional and had great customer service to address my issue. Will be coming back due to the customer service delivered by the manager Amanda.

My 2 children (both under 10 years) and I stopped by for an early dinner on my birthday. We received excellent service & a complimentary ice-cream sundae for my birthday. Our server actually offered to bring us 2 sundaes but one was more than enough for all three of us (and we still were unable to finish it.) Awesome job..!

I ate there yesterday with my husband and two children. I am happy to say it will be out last! The service was horrible. We were served our meal without napkins and silverware. Our waitress disappeared and we had to  hunt her down.  The place smelled terrible and there was trash all over the floor.  We could see the kitchen when the door opened to see an overflowing trash can. I did not speak to a manager but I am sure the manager could see how dirty the restaurant was.  When we got up and old milkshake cup rolled out.  Never again! I'd rather go to McDonald's (and I hate McDonald's).

Horrible service. The hostess seemed to be in another world when seating our party of six, the wait for our food was almost 45 minutes on a Tuesday night, the food was cold, and they waited until they came out with our food to tell us that they were out of corn dogs which meant we had to wait another 15 minutes or so for my son's meal. Our server was apologetic and the MOD claimed that the kitchen got hit all at once which I don't believe b/c our full order had been placed at least 15 minutes before two other tables came in.

Friday night and we decided to go grab a bite to eat after work. The service started pretty slow, but we didn't care much as we were playing the trivia thingy game.  We ordered burgers, it took 45 minutes to get to our table and were disgustingly cold. The "crispy" onion rings that topped the burger patty were a slushy disgusting mess. The "bottomless" fries were not seasoned at all, cold as well. My friend ordered another round of her fries, which took about 15 minutes to get.  All our plates and glasses stayed piled up at the edge of our table (3 people at a small table) for over and hour, the waitress seemed so disinterested to serve us.  Food - disgusting.  Service - horrible
Service at the bar and to go was horrible. Messed up my order and slow. Better service siting Down

This is one of my spots! I always come here because I Iove the Bansai burger. But since I'm working on being healthy, I decided to try something new. I had the whiskey BBQ wrap. Now this was a decent wrap. However it was cold as ice. The waitress was so busy I couldn't get an opportunity to ask her if it was supposed to be cold. I would have told them to warm the chicken at least. I don't know if it was hunger, but I made it thru that wrap. Fries always on point.  Service is ok. Waitress doesn't come back to the table often. But that would annoy me.  Bathroom . They need to keep that clean. Napkins all over so that made me iffy about rolling thru again.

Pretty awful in too many ways to list.  Server was really nice but made at least 3 mistakes. Never got the app we ordered and it wasn't in the bill. She just forgot. Sweet potato fries had been sitting for hours and we never guy the fresh ones we asked for. Not very clean. Beer was cold so that was ok but won't be going back.

If I could give a zero star, I would.  I don't know where to begin, so I'll start with the appetizer.  Or rather, not start with the appetizer because it didn't come until my dinner came.   Let me stop here and emphasize that only MY dinner came, not my hungry little boy's.  I told the waitress I no longer wanted my appetizer.  Instead of leaving silverware, so that I could start my dinner, she left.  Fast forward 15 minutes.  I finally got up to track down the waitress and find out where my son's food was.  The response: "he doesn't have his food yet?"  "Well, no, that's why I'm asking you", I thought to myself, but simply responded "No, not yet".  "Let me go see about that" she says.  Moments later, she flies to the table, drops off a piping hot plate in front of my son - who, thankfully, knew not to touch it - hovers over the table for a few seconds, and asks "is everything okay now?".  Then, after I give my obligatory nod, she speeds away.  It gets better, but there is not enough room here.  I will just add one last highlight: the famous and promised "bottomless fries" were cold and tough, so I asked if we could have some hot, fresh fries.  "Oh, of course!" she exclaims in that characteristic mea culpa tone.  Five minutes later the hot and delicious fries came.  Unfortunately, there were only 8 of them.   The meat and the fries are delicious at Red Robbins - well, the fries are, when they are hot.  The service at this particular one- not so much.
The kitchen area was very dirty from what we can see from our seats. The food was ok.the server was alsome.

As a vegan, I probably shouldn't expect much from a burger joint, and they delivered.  We came here for a family dinner. It is great that they have a vegan burger and appetizers, but that is about all I have to say that is nice about this place. I should flag that none of the burger buns are vegan, which is disappointing.  Everyone had food was served at room temperature, and it  probably wouldn't have been that good, even if it was warm. The wait staff was nice, but is slow to respond. It is great that they have a service call button, but it took 10 minutes for someone to answer our call. This also makes the claim of "bottomless" fries a joke because we couldn't get them to bring additional fries anyways. We raised our concerns with the management and they comped our meals 50%, which was nice but not enough for me to come here again ever.

Nice service. Came time in one week. First time was absolutely great and we sat directly at the bar. The second time was great too but the customer service wasn't as great as the first day... Lady with red hair wasn't that interpersonal which is why I gave it a four.

Horrible service! I waited 35 minutes for a table while there were plenty of seats available. And over an hour wait for my food. The restaurant is newly renovated, which is nice. But they did not make good use of the space.  My waitress was polite, but I would not recommend this location...especially if you are starving!!

Aysia is amazing!!!!!!! The service here is excellent. They made sure our friend, who is extremely allergic to tomatoes, had her food prepared specifically without any tomatoes. From management down to servers... 5 STARS

Ordered the Marco Polo with sweet potatoes fries and Thai sauce.  The chicken sandwich was amazing and beyond expectations. The fries like always were perfect. The only reason it isn't a 5 start is because of the waiter he could've been more attentive

I came here with my sister for a late lunch/dinner. We were seated right away. Our waiter was very nice and attentive. The food was good and it came quick. I really liked that we have a choice of steak fries, broccoli or sweet potatoes fries as our bottomless. Def will be back :)

Usually come here often when im in town. Hit or miss on the service. Today was exceptionally slow for lunch. There wasnt alot of customers and took forever to get drinks let alone one of our entrees we didnt receive until we were done with the first

The quality of food seems to have gone down at Red Robin.  This used to be a family friendly, affordable and tasty restaurant, which has now converted to just family friendly and affordable.  Was here for a graduation celebration the other day and the food was sub par.  While they still offer some great incentives like bottom less fries, the other food is just not good anymore.  It's seems to be that way since they started increasing the options on the menu.  Maybe too many options don't allow the cooks to focus in on their specialties and provide good food?  Maybe they're skimping on ingredients....I don't know what it is, but I wish it would revert to years past.   On another note, we had a large party and tried to break up our bill using the mini computer on the table - that didn't work so well.  After the first person did their bill, the thing went haywire and there was all kinds of confusion with the remaining persons.  The waiter was as helpful as he could be given the situation.  Lesson learned would be to let the server know in advance how we would like our bill so as to not spend an extra 40 min in the restaurant trying to get it taken care of.   Pro of the Evening: The freckled lemonade is still good.  Doesn't come in the fancy swirl glasses anymore though.

The food is awesome but the service at this location is always horrible  everytime i have been here (i go for my son it is his favorite place) The service lacks  The tables are left for hours not being cleaned off (trust me i know thats how long we sat there waiting for our waitress) its kind of not a good look to those coming in all these dirty tables Im assuming they have only one bus boy because the waiters/waitresses do not clear any of the tables whatsoever they leave it for the busboy seeing as we sit as long as we do waiting for our non busy waitstaff to serve us while they are not doing anything dont see why you dont have them put the effort in to cleaning those tables!

Where do I start...  First arrive to Red Robin and was seated right away, which I really appreciated. The greeter was nice and was very polite. Walking through the restaurant, many tables were not wiped and full of  dishes from the previous customers. After being seated, within two minutes our waiter came to take our drink order and came back within a decent time. She brought our drinks back and asked if we were ready. We proceed to place our order and she was nice about answering our questions about the menu. Now that our order is place, we're just observing how no one is cleaning up the place. When our food arrives, our order was not brought out as ordered. Which wasn't a big problem at first. Until we found out we didn't have any silverware or napkins. Wow! That should be the first thing on the table. Maybe it's just me. Our waiter came back and asked was everything okay. We mention that we did not have silverware and needed some extra item. She said okay and proceed to go take two more tables orders before grabbing utensils so we can enjoy our food while it's hot. No one likes cold food. So minutes went by and the manager came by, which was just walking around looking at these dirty tables. So, we finally stopped him and told him about our experience thus far. His word out of his mouth was, " Sorry to hear about the utensils, I would go grab that for you. Would you like for me to warm up your burger for you?" No sir but the silverware would be nice. After ten mins of waiting on something to eat with and you just want to re-warm my burger. I could totally understand if the place was busy or Understaff but this was not the case. I'm a frequent customer to Red Robin but not this particular one but if this was my first experience, it would definitely be my last. PLEASE AVOID THIS RED ROBINS AT ALL COST.

This rating is mainly for the food. In all honesty it was pretty awful.  Only one person at our table of 4 received what they actually ordered. When the food came it was not near how it was described in the menu. Ended up paying $15 for a regular burger with a glob of blue cheese on it. Really disappointing.

Service is a little on the slow side, but the food is very good and my favorite is at the Banzai Burger. Get great appetizers and desserts. I try to avoid it on Friday and Saturdays due to the long waits for seating.

Went on a Sunday evening... There was no wait. We were waited on promptly and our waitress was attentive and polite. The food was great. The chicken tender salad was fresh and yummy! My husband got the gourmet burger and it looked good and he gave it two thumbs up! The kids menu had a large variety. We would definitely go back!

The food itself was pretty good. Nothing out of the ordinary or special, but good. The cupcake milkshake was delicious.  With that said, the cleanliness of the restaurant was in question. From a first glance, everything looked okay - pretty clean, but close up, it wasn't. The kiosk tablet thingy was pretty dirty, the table wasn't very well cleaned, and curtain blinds were dusty. Service was also a bit meh, nothing special or nothing bad, but generally, slow and a bit uncaring, for a lack of better words.  Would I come again? Maybe. But they definitely should take better care of cleaning the place up, and keeping the kiosk tablets cleaned and germ-free.

Service was extremely slow. Silverware was dirty. Not busy at all, food took forever, and to top it off, it smelled of sour, dirty carpet, and the floors were in fact very dirty. Food quality was average, much less than I have come to expect from red robin. Someone from corporate needs to clean house at this location.

Day/Time of Visit: Sunday, 4:20pm I love some burger joints. I've been to the Red Robin in Columbia once prior to today's visit and I remember saying how good the burger was when I ate it. Sadly, today is different.   The wait was 30 minutes for a party of 5. Now, I don't know the restaurant business but I recall hearing that tables are often left open due to a server not being able to take care of that area. All I'm saying is, if that's the case, then those serving you should do that in a timely manner. Our waitress was very pleasant and nice; however, she did end up getting a party of 30 right after putting out order in. If that's the case, give the poor girl help or dedicate one server to that party. She dealt with that party and our table; however, due to the size, neglected us. And what's the point of the machine at the table to "call server" when they don't come??  The gist, service sucked.  Food wise, not that great either. The burger wasn't good, well, it was okay. But I definitely had better. Maybe it's just this location....?

This was the first time in a very long time that I actually am looking forward to my next visit. We used to come here at least weekly. In the last 3 ish years we have gone infrequently and generally been disappointed in the food and service. My Black and Blue burger was incredible. The service was friendly and efficient. She stopped by with a smile and and it reminded me of when the place opened. Please keep up the good work.
This location had the worst service ever. Long ticket times on food and drinks. I have given them chance after chance no improvement.  Tonight was no exception. I walked out.

From the unwelcoming hostess with her pants sagging, to the lengthy wait times at a slow hour, this location is one I'll never visit again. I ordered the "red blend" and was served a white wine... When I asked the waiter if it was the right wine he said yes. I had to point out that red blend meant red. Next came our salad... Wilted and brown.... Literally brown. I asked my waiter if it looked appetizing and he said no and walked off rolling his eyes without so much as an apology. The manager came over and asked if all was well.... When I asked if he'd seen the salad he said no and I told him he may want to look at it to see what was coming out of his kitchen. We hadn't even ordered yet (still waiting) and he offered to take our order. I added sweet potato fries and he was sure to point out it was a dollar up charge. Way to make an inconvenienced guest feel welcome. Never. Again.

Low quality food. Poor, clueless service. Tables are set up in a very open manner so that if a large party comes in with children it will overrun your space. The boneless wings are breaded and fried to the extent that they must be over 50% pure grease. I did not expect them to be prepared that way, but the server didn't come back for so long,  and I was starving so I ate a few. I made a mistake and paid for it for many hours afterwards.  Five Guys hamburgers are several times superior to these poor quality burgers. There is just no comparison.  I will never return even if there is no alternative to eat anywhere else. It was that bad.

my visit at this Red Robin left a burn taste in my mouth. The seats had food on them and it was given to us cold. There was also an ant  crawling on the side of the counter. when I hear the red robin slogan and people say yum, I'll say not,sorry I feel this way but it is what it is. they need to send the under boss to your location.

Went to this place last night and I was pleasantly surprised. Most of the reviews give this place a 3 however the food and the service I received was a Solid 5. It was funny the lady that served us was a vegan, however she knew everything that was on the menu and pointed out the more popular menu items. I was greeted when I walked in the door, and seated about 5 minutes after. Then a server was taking our order about 5 minutes after we were seated. We only waited about 5 minutes to get our drinks. Then about 5 more minutes for our appetizer of fries and cheese curds smothered in gravy...and about 5 minutes after that I recieved a nice big juicy burger with mayo...lettuce...tomatoes....mustered..bacon and a fried egg on top...lol oh I had a vanilla malt to wash it all down. So how could I not give this place a 5....BTW the lighting was perfect I left my glasses at home lol
Was there between 4-5pm. Good food, good service a bit on the pricey side but I was hungry

I really feel like this was closer to a three-star experience, but the "Meh, I've experienced better" category seems to fit better. The service was good, I cannot fault that.  The server we had was pretty attentive (only had one instance where I felt like we hadn't seen him in a while).  When he was present, he was friendly and helpful.  Maybe the servers should write orders down more, though, because we had a couple of miscues with our party. First, my salsa was missing (more on that later).  Second, one of the kids' meals was supposed to have apples, and it came with oranges instead.  Not the end of the world, but still worth noting. About the salsa... a buck for a small plastic ramekin of mediocre salsa?  Really?  THAT cost a dollar?  Yeah, I don't think so. I ordered the Wedgie burger to try something different.  There is no bun, but two big chunks of iceberg lettuce.  It was only so-so.  The lettuce was the predominant flavor, there wasn't nearly enough guacamole on it, the onions were entirely too plentiful and overwhelming, and the burgers have an off flavor.  I can't describe it, but if I had to, it tastes like the grill, like a gas grill. I swapped out the fries for the freckled fruit salad, which was okay, but the fruit was macerated.  It still tasted fine, but it might not be the texture that patrons are expecting. The poutine starter was pretty good, I will say that.  The cheese curds were fried, but that didn't detract from the overall dish.  Not 100% authentic because of it, but who's checking?  The taste was spot on. Overall, just okay.  I liked the app and bottomless root beer float, but the burger (what you're supposed to be going there for) is probably the last burger on my list of preferred options.  Bottomless sides and drinks do not compensate for a less-than-middle-of-the-road main entrée.

We have had several good experiences here.  I have always liked my food, and so have my husband and kids.  It's been remodeled recently, so the dining area looks really good. It can be on the slow side, so take that into account.

We won't go to this Red Robin again. Customer service isn't the best. The last time we went, the waitress was not very attentive. We had to track her down to get a refill. But nonetheless, we decided to give it another try. We were seated rather quickly but after almost 20 mins of not even having anyone take our drink orders, we got up and decided to go across the street to Longhorn. It wasn't busy at all so there was no excuse for such poor service. Staff seemed to just be standing around socializing, not caring at all about the customers. If you're really hungry or would at least like decent customer service, don't go here.

This location does not live up to Red Robin quality. I have been to several other locations and got the same burger and enjoyed it so much. It's interesting that they mess up their specialty burgers and "Red Robin Favorites" every time. There service is also not good.

Food was amazing! The service was absolutely terrible, worst service I've ever had. The restaurant was pretty empty, our food came out rather late but that was ok since the burgers were well worth the wait. However, the rest is a nightmare! We were never offered refills on our unlimited drinks or bottomless steak fries. When I finally asked for a refill on fries they brought out like 3 fries. Then I ordered a bud light from their all day happy hour menu, which I never received. Finally when the waiter came to put our orders on the self pay machine that's when he remembered about my forgotten beer, and all he said was "my bad". I'm all for teenagers working but please make sure you hire people with enthusiasm who actually want to do the job and are willing to pay attention to the customers.

Red Robin ,  one of my favorite places. But I must say this location is the worst I've been to yet. Once my stable birthday celebration spot, has turned into my last resort. Upon my last visit, a fellow customer was drenched in there own beverage by their waitress. After they gave her a new shirt to wear, she had to plead on getting a free meal. I was able to watch this whole encounter because.... my meal was taking 5eva.

This is only my second time here,first time with a large party of 10 food was good service was also. This time dinning alone the service I must say is very good better than the last time and that was good. Food came fast I will be back when craving a burger or or large salad
Burgers are great but the service is always so slow.. The excuse is that they are short on cooks...

This weekend was my second trip to this Red Robin location.  I went this weekend for my mother's birthday lunch. Service:  I'll start by saying that the management at this store, they are the real mvp.  We had a waiter that either was very distracted or very new.  Everything that we ordered was incorrect.  I don't eat mayo and my mom wasn't sure if she would the dijon sauce on her burger, so we asked to have them without both condiments.  They both came to the table with those condiments.  We also had to repeatedly ask for things such as water, straws, refill of fries, and etc.  I had to wait so long for my burger to be remade that I became full on fries. However, the management did come over and help everything get fixed.  They also made sure to check on us and make sure things were getting better. Food:  Red Robin is known for their burgers, so I always come here to get a unique burger.  I ordered the southern charm and my mom ordered the black and bleu.  My burger (once corrected) was great.  I also get extra onion straws on the side to add to my burger.  My mom also enjoyed her black and bleu burger (she loves bleu cheese).  The garlic parm fries are GREAT and I loved them.  They were perfectly flavored. Overall:  I would return, but I wouldn't rush to come back to this location.  I think with time the management will be able to give their staff the training that they need.  I believe they have potential because the management already has what it take to be successful.

Had an awesome dining experience! The service was incredible! Our waiter, Brandon, was awesome. Very attentive, polite, friendly, and upbeat. He checked on us and made sure that our food was what we wanted. He was on top of refilling our drinks when they were getting low and bringing out napkins before we even needed them.  I ordered my usual, which is a bacon cheeseburger with American cheese and I add onion straws. The burger was cooked perfectly at medium. They have bottomless fries but I can only ever eat my one basket. I love the seasoning for the fries that is on the table. I asked for campfire sauce and ranch.  A great dining experience, which is rare to find sometimes!
