My family eats at red robin two to three times a month because they have gluten free options. Celiac disease can make eating out difficult. But thankfully, Red Robin made it easy... But the location in Bowie is a joke and might be the reason we switch over to Fuddruckers or Chickfila now that they both offer gluten free buns. The server was bubbly and polite but didn't bring our napkins and silverware until the end of the meal despite asking twice. She brought my wife the wrong meal and disagreed when my wife first pointed it out.  She was clearly over worked. But that didn't excuse the fact that our food also came out cold. Heat lamps don't keep the inside of a burger warm, y'all. Lastly, she never asked how our meal was, if we wanted more fries, or drinks. Clearly she needed help. (The manager came by the table behind us who was also given the wrong meals and they were pissed because they had to wait to catch bc the waitresses who didn't rush to fix theirs) Won't be back to that location ever.

The worst service that I've ever had at a Red Robin.  Our waiter was awful and the food was not good at all.  The onion rings were bland and the French fries were either soggy (under cooked) or hard (over cooked).  The manager did a good job of helping the wait staff but he should not have been working that hard...there was more than enough staff there to the support the customers.  It seemed the staff was more busy socializing.

I love the table games here. Random, yes I know. Bottomless fries were seasoned to perfection. Smoke and Pepper burger - meh. Nothing to write home about, but I wanted to try something new. Our server was great!

This is my second time coming to this location. I don't know why I came a second time. The first time I came they took forever and the experience was not great. Now I came a second time and the same thing and it took forever. Long times taken to order. I think it felt like 15 to 20 minutes just for us to order. Ridiculous. And then just to get any thing took forever. Just never again. I have been to better and will continue to go to them.

So much to say, but just gonna put down the word, "ghetto". Ok so Yelp is saying I am short on words. Here goes: We came in an hour before closing on Saturday night (closes 11pm).  We sat at the bar and placed our orders. We got our drinks fast. Thats good. The bar seemed like a mess though. The bartender was busy cleaning and shutting down machines. Trash was being emptied. It just seemed like they were more concerned with cleaning and getting out. I felt like I was in their way.  When the food arrived the bartender dropped the plates on the counter for us. My date asked me why the bartender slammed the food on the counter. He did kinda just dropped the plates instead of placing it nicely.  How would you feel if someone aggressively served your plate? Makes it feel cheap. Which brings me to the food quality.  It felt like mcdonalds. Maybe that is an insult to mcdonalds. Honestly. Was Red Robins always like this?  I had fond memories of the restaurant. I guess i never been to this area. How embarrassed I was when I recommended this place for dinner.  The burger was thin, its a joke to ask you how you like it. Its gonna be dry and well done no matter what you choose. The lettuce was shredded like it came from a bag. Everything felt like it came from a bag. The buns looked like from Giant or some super market. It didnt taste good. The fries were fine but i didnt want to seem rude to the bartender and dare ask for refills for the never ending basket. He was still busy packing everything up.  I dont recommend coming here. At least not at night or close to closing time. Edit:  oh how can i forget about the restroom!  I think the mens bathroom was a tribute to hurricane Harvey as the floors were flooded and a mess.

So Red robin has been getting some bad rep lately but the place has changed and looks a lot better. I had an issue with one of my orders during the July 4th holiday and sent an email to corporate. I figured they were swamped so I understand the mix up in food. I got a response from corporate but also got a call from the manager there (Jeremy) apologizing for the mixup. I felt like their customer service is improving. No place is perfect but I can appreciate businesses attempting and trying their hardest to please customers. For this reason, I'm giving them a 5 star. Sometimes you just have to be patient and respect those working hard. We are all human and can make mistakes. Thank you for fixing a simple error.
I stop by every once in a blue moon and have never been disappointed. Great onion rings, good fries and decent burgers.

I must have been in the right place at the right time.  My experience was good.   The food was good, the service was attentive and the atmosphere was eclectic but nice.  Every space in the restaurant has something on it including the ceiling. We started out with the BBQ pork loaded chips, sweet sauce and little meat.  The chips were kettle cooked garnished with a cheese sauce and BBQ pork.  This came out looking just like its picture on the menu.  Tasty and light enough to leave room for the burgers.   I've watched too many episodes of Monsters Inside on animal planet so I always order my meat well done.  To my surprise I received a perfect burger flavorful, juicy and tender.  The black and blue burger was not overwhelming the blue cheese was rather mild next time I'll add bacon and a tomato.    The star burger was the Mad Love burger.  This has everything you could ask for in a great burger and next time it's what I'll order.  The fries were just ok.  We visited on Black Friday around 5pm the day that most people are still eating leftovers so our timing helped get us in and out quickly.  The self service paying is great.   I'll return.

Not bad for take out or even to grab a quick burger. I love their buffalo chicken salad and garlic Parmesan fries but only can eat those on a. Hart day. They get you in and out and give pretty decent customer service. This is my go to Red Robin. I don't care much for the on in Crofton, but this location is more convenient for me.

Walked in, there's clearly a wait. No one at the host booth. An employee walks to a booth, picks up the phone and takes an order. We made eye contact before she picked up the phone. That didn't matter, at all. She carefully took the order then told us someone is coming. Then she walked away. That was our cue, a swift departure soon followed. I didn't wanna eat there anyway. Thanks for NOTHING!!!
